image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Melania Trump's 'I am the most bullied person' video viral as she 'rejects' Jill Biden's tea invite
item.description: In a 2018 ABC interview, Melania Trump said she thought she was the most bullied person, one of the most bullied persons in the world. The clip resurfaced and went viral as Melania's reported rejection of Jill Biden's invitation for tea Wednesday came under scrutiny. Melania will be more absent this time than earlier as she declined even the first formality, it is being speculated.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump announces Mike Huckabee as ambassador to Israel: 'He loves...'
item.description: "Mike has been a great public servant, Governor, and Leader in Faith for many years. He loves Israel, and the people of Israel, and likewise, the people of Israel love him. Mike will work tirelessly to bring about Peace in the Middle East!" Donald Trump posted on Truth Social announcing his latest appointment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump taking Vivek Ramaswamy, Charlie Kirk's advice on staff selection: 'Not only Elon Musk'
item.description: It was Trump Jr who shot down any discussion of Mike Pompeo or Nikki Haley for any official roles as he made it clear that his father would only take loyalists as his staff. "Trump's transition co-chairs are Lutnick and Linda McMahon, but there are Elon Musk, Vice President-elect JD Vance, Donald Trump Jr, Tulsi Gabbard, Kennedy. There’s also a rotating cast of conservative influencers like Charlie Kirk and Vivek Ramaswamy, according to four people with knowledge of the meetings," Politico reported.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Archbishop of Canterbury, Trump critic Justin Welby resigns. What is the sex abuse scandal?
item.description: Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby announced his resignation amid mounting pressure over his handling of sexual abuse allegations. The scandal involves late John Smyth, who was accused of abusing numerous boys over decades. Welby, who also presided over Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding and King Charles III's coronation, expressed remorse for his inaction.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Severe turbulence injures 11 on Lufthansa flight from Buenos Aires to Frankfurt
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump's project 2025 aims to dismantle department of education with Musk’s backing in plan for schools
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Kamala Harris and Jill Biden ignore each other in viral video? Watch
item.description: It is not a secret that both Joe Biden and Jill held a grudge when the outgoing president was made to drop out of the presidential election. It was a decision dominated by the party veterans and Biden had no other option than to abide by endorsing Kamala Harris. Jill Biden too campaigned for Kamala Harris but the Bidens did not let go of the grudge.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump Jr hints at major action on Diddy; seeks the whole list of party attendees
item.description: Donald Trump Jr. suggested that his father's administration would take a strong stance on sex trafficking allegations against rapper P. Diddy. This comes after a report surfaced alleging the presence of minors at Diddy's private parties known as "Freak-Offs," where sexual misconduct was alleged to have taken place. "We want the whole list of who was there. Sunlight is the best disinfectant!!" he posted.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Saudi crown prince condemns Israel’s ‘genocide' against Palestinians, warns against military action in Iran
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Laura Loomer attacks AOC, asks if she'd admit her pregnancy or wait till 9th month to...
item.description: Far-right activist Laura Loomer has reignited pregnancy rumors about Democratic Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez following the election. Loomer publicly questioned if AOC would now address the rumors, which she had also circulated before the election. "Hey @AOC The election is over. You can come out and finally admit you're pregnant. Or are you waiting till the 9th month to abort? The election is over, cupcake?" Laura Loomer posted.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Elon Musk still at Mar-a-Lago, dining and playing golf with Donald Trump?
item.description: Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago mansion is teeming with two kinds of people now -- one those who are looking for jobs at the new Trump administration and the second are those who are looking to influence Trump on those picks. And Elon Musk has been looming over all of that. He may not have a direct role inside the administration as that would be complicated for all the companies that he owns but he probably does not need one as he has much influence from outside.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: War on 'woke' universities: Donald Trump's 10-point plan to 'fix' American education
item.description: By firing current accreditors and enforcing new standards that emphasise American values, free speech, and career readiness, Trump proposes to hold institutions accountable, reduce administrative costs, and introduce accelerated, affordable degree options. His plan also includes penalties for schools engaged in discriminatory practices, including potential taxes on endowments to fund restitution for those affected.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I was paid nothing': Oprah denies getting $1 million from Harris campaign as more details emerge
item.description: Records revealed that Kamala Harris campaign indeed paid $1 million to Oprah Winfrey's production house Harpo Productions in October. But Winfrey said she was not paid anything. Her company said Kamala Harris campaign paid the production cost of the live-streaming event 'Unite for America' which featured many celebrities like Meryl Streep, Jennifer Lopez, and Julia Roberts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Melania won't join Trump in customary White House meeting: 'Bidens are disgusting'
item.description: Melania Trump declined Jill Biden's invitation for tea at the White House as their husbands meet for the customary post-election lunch. Melania reportedly cited a scheduling conflict but sources suggested Melania's decision stems from her strong disapproval of the Bidens following the FBI search of Mar-a-Lago as part of the government's investigation into classified documents.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Video of Indonesian President congratulating Trump on election win goes viral
item.description: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto, advocating for a neutral foreign policy, congratulated Donald Trump on his electoral success in a phone call. During the call, Trump boasted about his win and acknowledged an assassination attempt during his campaign. The call took place before Prabowo's meeting with President Biden in Washington, where he also encouraged investments from US corporations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How hankering for orange juice got this North Carolina woman 250,000 dollars
item.description: Spahr’s plan was simply to grab orange juice, but the new lottery tickets at the shop caught her eye. "When I noticed they had new tickets at the petrol station, I thought I’d give it a try," she said. She chose a $20 “Merry Multiplier” scratch-off ticket, partly because it had a foldable part that piqued her curiosity. Her odds of winning the top prize? Approximately 1 in 1.2 million – a slim chance, yet one that changed her life.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Short cut to feminism: How an assault changed Korean woman's outlook
item.description: Aspiring South Korean writer On Ji-goo never considered herself a feminist but changed her mind after being physically attacked by a man for having short hair. "When I first heard that having short hair meant you were a feminist, I found it absurd," On said.

item.title: What is 4B movement and why are American women advocating it after Trump's win
item.description: Originating in South Korea, the "4B" movement, advocating against dating, sex, marriage, and childbearing with men, is gaining global traction. Sparked by gender inequality concerns, the movement resonates with American women following Trump's election and anxieties surrounding women's rights. This trend reflects a broader shift where women are challenging traditional roles and demanding societal change.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China military displays upgraded Z-20 helicopter at Zhuhai air show
item.description: China unveiled its advanced Z-20 helicopter at an air show, showcasing its potential for naval warfare, particularly in anti-submarine operations. Experts believe the Z-20 will significantly enhance the Chinese navy's ability to detect and counter submarines, addressing a critical vulnerability in its defenses. The helicopter's advanced capabilities and potential deployment on various warships are raising concerns among regional rivals.

item.title: 'Horrific': New Zealand PM offers national apology to people abused in care
item.description: New Zealand's Prime Minister issued a historic apology for the abuse suffered by an estimated 200,000 children and vulnerable adults in state and religious care facilities over 70 years. The apology follows a six-year inquiry that revealed horrific physical, sexual, and psychological abuse, disproportionately impacting the Māori community.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
